bug.author: monchier
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
If I upload a file on a tab, any file uploaded on the other tab disappear <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
I used this script: <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarcSkovMadsen/awesome-streamlit/master/gallery/file_uploader_multiple_files/file_uploader_multiple_files.py>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarcSkovMadsen/awesome-streamlit/master/gallery/file_uploader_multiple_files/file_uploader_multiple_files.py</denchmark-link>
Run the script in two tabs: <denchmark-code>streamlit run file_uploader_multiple_files.py &; streamlit run file_uploader_multiple_files.py </denchmark-code>
Upload a file in tab 1. Upload another file in tab 2. Go to tab 1 and refresh. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Tab 1 still shows the first file. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Tab 1 does not show any file. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.55 Python version: (get it with $ python --version) Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? OS version: Browser version:
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/crosstalk-between-streamlit-sessions-with-multiple-users/319/8?u=monchier>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/crosstalk-between-streamlit-sessions-with-multiple-users/319/8?u=monchier</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Files are mapped to widget id + session id so the actual behavior in this case is expected.
